title: Integrated RNA-seq Pipeline for TAC vs. SHAM Cardiomyocyte Analysis
summary: End-to-end RNA-seq workflow covering SRA retrieval, STAR alignment to GRCm39, Salmon quantification, TMM-normalised QC, and TAC_vs_SHAM differential modelling with isoform exploration.
description: End-to-end RNA-seq workflow covering SRA data retrieval, STAR alignment to the GRCm39 mouse genome, Salmon quantification, count aggregation, and edgeR analyses (TMM normalisation, PCA, TAC_vs_SHAM contrast, Naca isoform exploration).
highlights: Automated SRA Toolkit downloads and STAR alignment against the GRCm39 mouse genome.
Salmon quantification with aggregated counts, TMM normalisation, and PCA quality diagnostics.
edgeR modelling for TAC vs. SHAM contrasts with focused Naca isoform interrogation.

image.alt: Laboratory workstation prepared for RNA sequencing protocols

title: Population Genetics Workflow for ADHD GWAS Loci
summary: Combined R and Python tooling to annotate ADHD SNPs, retrieve LD haplotypes, stream 1000 Genomes slices, and fuse Tajima's D with iHS metrics for comparative genetics dashboards.
description: Integrates R- and Python-based steps to annotate ADHD-associated SNPs via Ensembl/biomaRt, retrieve LD haplotypes with LDlinkR, pull 1000 Genomes Phase 3 slices through bcftools, compute Tajima’s D on SAS cohorts using scikit-allel, and merge selection metrics (Tajima’s D & iHS) for comparative visualisation and downstream notebooks/Rmd exploration.
highlights: Annotated ADHD-associated SNPs using Ensembl biomaRt and LDlinkR haplotype queries.
Streamed 1000 Genomes Phase 3 data via bcftools and computed SAS Tajima's D with scikit-allel.
Blended Tajima's D and iHS selection metrics into comparative analytics notebooks.

image.alt: DNA double helix rendered with data overlays

title: Conserved HXNY Influenza A Alignment and Conservation Analysis
summary: R-driven pipeline for curating GISAID HXNY panels, Dockerised MAFFT alignments, phylogenetic triage, and residue conservation maps ready for Jalview exploration.
description: R-based workflow that curates GISAID HA/NA segment FASTA collections, extracts subtype metadata, samples representative panels, and performs Dockerized MAFFT alignments for global and subtype-specific cohorts. Downstream steps organise Jalview-ready matrices, generate phylogenetic trees to isolate H1 vs. broader HX clades, and compute group-wise conservation profiles to pinpoint residues uniquely preserved within target lineages.
highlights: Curated GISAID HA/NA FASTA panels with subtype-aware sampling inside R.
Ran Dockerised MAFFT alignments for global and subtype-specific cohorts and exported Jalview-ready matrices.
Generated phylogenetic trees and residue conservation profiles to isolate HX lineage signatures.

title: Multifactor RNA-seq Reanalysis for ACC Patient Cohort
summary: Reproducible R notebooks harmonising vendor counts, running edgeR/DESeq2 models with covariates, and benchmarking ACC results with KEGG enrichment outputs.
description: Reproducible R-based workflow that ingests vendor-delivered Excel count matrices and patient metadata to interrogate adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) versus control samples. The notebooks harmonize sample annotations, perform TMM-normalised edgeR and DESeq2 models (univariate, age/sex-adjusted, and sensitivity analyses removing older or outlier donors), and contrast findings against the BMK report. Quality checks span library-size diagnostics, XY-driven sex validation, PCA before/after ComBat_seq batch correction, and top-gene expression visualisation. Downstream, differential results feed KEGG enrichment via multiGSEA/WebGestaltR with reports written to results/.
highlights: Standardised vendor Excel matrices and metadata for reproducible ACC cohort interrogation.
Executed edgeR and DESeq2 models with covariate adjustments, sensitivity sweeps, and ComBat_seq corrections.
Delivered KEGG enrichment summaries via multiGSEA/WebGestaltR with reporting to results/.

image.alt: Data scientists validating RNA-seq quality metrics

title: Integrated KEGG Pathway Analytics for HCC1143/HCC1937 Multi-Omics Time Series
summary: Concise R workflows unifying metabolomic and transcriptomic KEGG GSEA outputs, harmonising dotplot narratives, and extending overlays via pathview and OmnipathR.
description: Concise R workflows merge KEGG GSEA outputs from metabolomic and transcriptomic contrasts of HCC1143/HCC1937 (baseline, week 7, week 18), distil key pathway trends, and generate aligned dotplot PDFs alongside spreadsheet exports (see script/01_kegg-dotplot_pathwayss.R:17, script/02_KEGG_dotplot_pathway_metabolites.R:31, script/04_KEGG_combine_dotplots.R:44). Auxiliary scripts probe KEGG overlays with pathview and extend ID translation via OmnipathR (see script/test_kegg_representation/06_pathview.R:15, script/test_kegg_representation/omnipath_R.R:3).
highlights: Consolidated KEGG GSEA outputs across metabolomic and transcriptomic contrasts for three time points.
Automated comparative dotplot PDFs and spreadsheet exports for pathway storytelling.
Extended KEGG overlays with pathview and OmnipathR ID translations for deeper annotation.

title: Comprehensive ChIP-seq Analysis for HCT-116 Acidic pH Challenge
summary: Multi-script DiffBind pipeline covering normalisation, annotation, visualisation, enrichment, and genome browser summaries for pH-driven chromatin signalling.
description: DiffBind pipeline builds the sample sheet from aligned BAM and peak calls, normalizes binding affinities, and generates PCA plus multi-contrast differential reports for pH 6.5, 7.4, and transition conditions (script/01_diffbind.R:1). Annotated peak tables map to hg38 genes via ChIPpeakAnno/ChIPseeker, quantify genomic feature distributions, and export significant hit lists with WriteXLS (script/03_annotation.R:1). Volcano plots, CD68-focused scatter views, and top-peak RPKM jitter panels highlight condition-specific modulation across replicates (script/04_volcano.R:1, script/02_scatterplot_top_targets.R:1). WebGestaltR-driven multiGSEA ranks KEGG pathways, with comparative dot plots and lysosome-centric visualizations summarizing enriched signaling programs (script/05_multiGSEA_KEGG.R:1, script/06_kegg_dotplot_pathway.R:1, script/06_kegg_dotplot_pathway_lysosome_only.R:1). Genome browser tracks and DiffBind profile PDFs interrogate CD68, ARRDC4, and global binding landscapes using Gviz and BSgenome resources (script/07_peak_enrichment_cd68_and_other_genes.R:1, script/08_profiles.R:1).
highlights: DiffBind normalisation and multi-contrast reporting across acidic pH conditions.
Peak annotation and feature distribution summaries via ChIPpeakAnno and ChIPseeker.
Lysosome-focused KEGG enrichment with WebGestaltR plus Gviz browser tracks for key loci.

image.alt: ChIP-seq signal traces displayed on a workstation

title: Comprehensive Metabolomics Workflow for Multi-Cohort Breast Cancer Study
summary: Modular R analysis streamlining cohort harmonisation, subtype contrasts, predictive elastic-net models, and survival analytics with reporting outputs.
description: Modular R analysis suite that ingests clinical metabolomics panels, standardises metadata into SummarizedExperiment objects, and delivers cohort-specific answers to six study questions—ranging from descriptive clinical profiling to limma-based subtype contrasts, menopause and BMI associations, neoadjuvant pCR prediction with cross-validated elastic-net models, and Cox survival screening with Kaplan–Meier visualisations, all exporting tabular and PDF reports.
highlights: Standardised multi-cohort metabolomics into SummarizedExperiment workflows with tidyverse tooling.
Ran limma contrasts, elastic-net pCR models, and Cox survival screens with visual reporting.
Packaged tabular and PDF outputs for clinical collaborators.

title: Targeted Prophage Region Extraction for Bacillus cereus Genome
summary: Bioconductor-driven genome parsing to clip Bacillus cereus prophage loci, build per-region FASTA bundles, and prep assets for comparative genomics.
description: R-based workflow centered on script/01_extract_regions.R, leveraging Bioconductor’s Biostrings to parse the reference genome in data/sequence.fasta, clip five prophage-associated loci by coordinate, and emit per-region FASTA files in data_proc/. Companion Bacillus phage lambda sequences and a consolidated sequences.zip bundle support downstream comparative genomics or annotation work, while results/ is reserved for future analyses generated from these curated segments.
highlights: Scripted Biostrings extraction of five prophage-associated loci from Bacillus cereus.
Generated per-region FASTA outputs plus bundled archives for downstream workflows.
Provisioned companion phage references to streamline comparative analyses.
